intro: Dasystephana tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaf dasystephana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
